title: THE UNITED AGAINST GUN VIOLENCE CLUB (UAGV CLUB) OF MCLEAN HIGH SCHOOL

yaml.title: THE UNITED AGAINST GUN VIOLENCE CLUB (UAGV CLUB) OF MCLEAN HIGH SCHOOL

markdown.markdown:
The United Against Gun Violence Club at McLean High School is a passionate group of students dedicated to raising awareness, promoting education, and actively combating gun violence within our community. Our primary objective is to foster a safe and inclusive environment where students can stand up against gun violence through advocacy, event organization, and meaningful dialogue. By cultivating empathy, understanding, and a spirit of activism, our club aims to inspire positive change and advocate for peaceful solutions to address the multifaceted issue of gun violence. Together, as members of the United Against Gun Violence Club, we strive to create a safer future for all students.
::: {.column width="20%"} ![](imgs/dr_reid.png) ::: ::: {.column width="2%"} ::: ::: {.column width="24%"} ### Dr. Reid's Message on Gun Violence Prevention (September 21, 2023) Gun violence continues to impact communities across our nation. According to the non-profit Gun Violence Archive, there have already been more than 470 mass shootings across the United States this calendar year. The organization defines a mass shooting as an incident in which four or more people are injured or killed, including in homes and in public places. Read the full article: Gun Violence Prevention Letter \| Fairfax County Public Schools (fcps.edu) ::: ::: {.column width="15%"} ![](imgs/virginia.jpg) ::: ::: {.column width="2%"} ::: ::: {.column width="24%"} ### Gun Violence in Virginia In an average year, 992 people die by guns in Virginia. With a rate of 11.4 deaths per 100,000 people, Virginia has the 34th-highest rate of gun deaths in the United States. (Data provided by EveryStat for Gun Safty), read the full article here: Every-State-Fact-Sheet-2.0-042720-Virginia.pdf (everytownresearch.org) :::
